فيلم جريمة جميل
مبني على قصة حقيقية
يتحدث عن : رجل أسود أتهم ظلماً بإغتصاب إمرأة - إغتصبها قسيس - ، ثم دخل السجن ، ثم هرب منه ، ثم أحتجز أمرأة بيضاء كرهينة .
الفيلم فيه عدة جوانب إجتماعية :-
1- ظلم البريء وترك الظالم .
2- القاضي قتله ظلمه ، كالعابد قتلته فتواه .
3- ظلم المجتمع  - وخاصة العنصرية - للبريء تدفعه  للقتل والإنتقام .
4- المخدرات آفة عالمية .
5- المخدرات ملاذ الضعفاء .
6- المخدرات لها نشوة تدفع الإنسان للتحليق فوق السماء .
7- ضعف الإنسان أمام الشهوة .
8- إفراغ الهموم والأحزان بالوقوع في الأخطاء .
9- العصبية تدفع الإنسان لإرتكاب الجريمة والخطأ .
10- الجلسات السرية للمدمنين أفضل من المستشفيات الصحية في علاج الإدمان .
11- القسيس ليس قديس .
12- تكذيب بعض النصارى للكتاب المقدس ، بسبب جرائم الرهبان .
13- قرأة الكتب في القضايا النفسية ، تقوي العزيمة وتخفف الآلام .
14- حرمان الأبناء أعظم من القتل والسجن .
15- ربما ضارة خير من نافعة .
16- بناء البيوت في الغرب بأيدي أصحابها .
17- المشروبات الغازية تشغل بطارية السيارة .

Comment:
For those saying "why did they have to put so much religion in this story", I submit this: Without religion, this would not be a story.  Ashley would have been a dead addict on Brian's escape route.   

Regardless of how you feel about religion, this story is an accurate depiction of what was said and what happened that day. That book (Purpose driven life)  and religion were both a part of it. If you can't deal with that, don't watch the movie.

Title: Captive Official Trailer #1 (2015) - Kate Mara, David Oyelowo Movie HD
Comment:
I like David Oyelowo, he was very good in "Selma" but this movie seems kind of ridiculous.  "Loosely" based on a true story would be more accurate.  "Barely" works too.

As I understand it while she did read him some religious text, she pretty much got him drugged up and those drugs probably did more to save her life than some new found religion on his part.

I don't have a problem with the story, but lets not pretend that it's going to be anything like what really happened.

Comment: A lot of you are like 'He said God, I'm out'. I don't understand why. What if God is real? Then what? If you die, and find that you lived a short lifetime of 'freedom' and not worshiping God, you would find out that you must spend eternity in immense pain, because of your stubborn mind of wanting to do your own thing for less than a century. Eternity is a *lot* longer than a century. Just keep telling yourself God doesn't exist. Keep going until the end. Then the beginning of eternity will come and you will look in the future and understand, that you will never leave Hell and God will not show sympathy as you showed none towards him. Which is better, choosing to believe there is a higher power and then worshiping him, then being taken to heaven to live with that almighty God for eternity, or choosing to believe and die, with no regrets, as you would cease to exist. Either way, it turns out okay, in less of course, you decide to not believe, then you have a chance [a large chance at that] of spending eternity in Hell, a huge put of fire where you will experience pain that is literally out of this world. Would you bet on a horse, knowing you were going to either gain everything or not lose nothing or would you bet on a horse that would either make you lose nothing but gain nothing or lose everything. It's obvious what the answer is. Although I doubt that you read this far. So yeah. I didn't mean for it to go on this long. It just annoys me how stupid some people are.

Comment:
I recognize this "true story" -- it is of the hostage situation in Atlanta involving and murderer and a woman for several hours in 2005.

While she did claim that she read a chapter of Rick Warren's The Purpose Driven Life, she also admitted to giving him crystal meth for her release.

Suddenly, the miracle is a little less miraculous. Yet, for fairly obvious reasons, the director and producers won't include that part of the story.
